bill.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to increase the limitation on the deduction for State and local taxes.
bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 81 (Thursday, May 17, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. ROHRABACHER:H.R. 5872.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:The Sixteenth Amendment to the U.S. Constitution[Page H4210]

item.text: This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to increase the limitation on individual deductions for certain state and local taxes to $20,000 (currently $10,000) per year for individuals or $10,000 (currently $5,000) for married individuals filing a separate return.

dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
